page.title: 03FARMING
page.content: The pattern of farming is dictated by the nature of the land and by the prevailing farming trends. Six different farmers work the land but for two of them this represents only a small part of holdings well in excess of 1000 acres. The smallest farm in the area is 100 acres. There is no dairy, but one "outside" farmer grazes cows within the area. Dairying was widespread until the early 1970s when the local farmers accepted government payments to stop dairying. Now the pattern is to graze the water meadows, low lying land and steep areas difficult to cultivate. One farmer has sheep and three have beef cattle. The higher chalky downs are used for cereals, the most popular of the moment being the profitable oil-seed rape and winter wheat.
